column2: SOUTH CAROLINA DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: South Carolina
column6: SC

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. A broken yellow line in the center of the road indicates that:
column4: Passing is not permitted.
column6: Both lanes of traffic are going in the same direction.
column8: Passing is permitted in either direction.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road
column6: Sharp turn to the left

column2: 3. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: chasing or challenging other drivers.
column6: All of the above.
column8: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 4. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 5. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column4: one hour.
column6: 30 minutes.

column2: 6. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 7. This sign warns that:
column4: traffic must merge right.
column6: traffic must merge left.
column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 8. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: a divided highway is ahead.
column6: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 9. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
column6: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
column8: honk your horn and proceed with caution.

column2: 10. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
column4: Stop
column6: Yield

column2: 11. When you have to back up, you should:
column4: be sure the way is clear of any other traffic before backing.
column6: turn your head back before and while backing.

column2: 12. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column6: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column8: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.

column2: 13. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column6: Maintain the correct speed.

column2: 14. A flashing yellow light:
column4: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column6: is used at dangerous intersections.

column2: 15. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Area reserved for people with disabilities
column6: Hospital service

column2: 16. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the solid line may pass.
column6: next to the broken line may pass.

column2: 17. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from both directions.
column6: vehicles from the left.

column2: 18. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: go back and wait the “WALK” light
column6: finish crossing the street.

column2: 19. A motorist arriving at the intersection must yield the right of way to motorists who arrived before him.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 20. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
column6: you cannot pass.

column2: 21. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column6: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column8: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.

column2: 22. When the roadway ahead of you is flooded, you should:
column4: drive through the flooded area if safe.
column6: turn around and find another route.
column8: drive only in the center of the roadway.

column2: 23. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column6: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column8: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.

column2: 24. Alcohol:
column4: improves your reaction time.
column6: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column8: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

column2: 25. To prevent hydroplaning, you should:
column4: slow down.
column6: steer toward the shoulder of the road.

column2: 26. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when following motorcycles.
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 27. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the type of route you are on.
column6: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column8: the speed limit on that route.

column2: 28. The driver is about to:
column4: turn left.
column6: turn right.

column2: 29. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Diamond
column6: Octagon

column2: 30. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column6: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column8: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
